about_the_game:
HAZAMA_QUEEN's BGM now has a soundtrack!

In addition to remixes of each stage by the composer Crush-vAdin's bhaskara
In addition to remixes of each stage by the composer, Crush-vAdin's bhaskara, a bonus track by DJ Takemoto Sarai is also included!

It's a pleasure to hear it in this world, not in hell! Party night!

GUEST composer Sarai Takemoto


DJ who mainly performs House and Chiptune on VRChat and on live streaming.
He holds "Playhouse" at VRChat every Monday and "Electric Shock" at Asagaya Drift every other month.
He is currently holding "Electroshock" at Drift in Asagaya every other month.

Guest comments

My name is Sarai Takemoto, and I mainly play House DJ on VRChat and other streaming services.
This time, Mr. Bhaskara, who I met by chance, suddenly asked me to remix the soundtrack of a game he was working on.
I was surprised at first, but then I was afraid to ask him,
I was surprised and asked him if I could do it, but when I asked him about it, he told me that the background music was made in the form of short loops of sound that increased as the stage progressed.
The background music is made in the form of short loops of sound that increase as the stage progresses.
The background music was made in the form of short loops of sound that increased as the stage progressed. I can play with the loop material as I like and add other sounds as well.
I can do that, since I usually do that kind of thing! I thought, "I'm used to doing that kind of thing, so I can do it!
The game content was also very much to my liking.

I started working on ...... and found that the original loops were mostly psychedelic and trance-like, so I decided to see how I could make them sound the way I wanted them to.
So I wondered how I could make it my own, but I decided to start with a drum sample that I like.
I added a four-beat beat using my favorite drum samples as a habit, and it sounded like "Detroit techno".
Then I thought, "Why don't I try to make it sound like Detroit techno, with an analog feel? I came up with the idea of "how about making a techno sound with an analog feel like Detroit techno?
I was also influenced by this kind of techno sound when I first came into contact with it.
game music that was influenced by such techno music, so I was inspired and got absorbed in making it!

As a result, I think it has a different groove from that of the main game, while still retaining the game-like feel.
I think it ended up with a different vibe from the main story, while retaining the game-like feel, and I love it. I hope you enjoy it as much as I do!
